title: Canada federal election: Two years of Justin Trudeau in two minutes
description: As Canadians prepare to head back to the polls, here are some key moments since the last election.

title: Special-needs support beyond crisis, heads say
description: Funding has to rise so all pupils can be supported to learn, the National Association of Head Teachers says.

title: September 11: The heroes of the forgotten maritime rescue mission
description: On 11 September, 2001, nearly 500,000 people were evacuated by boat from southern Manhattan.

title: Could the boost to women’s football mean more online abuse?
description: Aston Villa player Anita Asante says she worries whether players will be able to ‘manage’ potential online abuse.

title: CEO Secrets: The bra boss busting stereotypes
description: Leanne Cahill, CEO of Bravissimo, shares her journey from shop floor to boardroom in retail.

title: Universal Credit: What £20 means to me
description: People on Universal Credit who received a £20 extra per week during the pandemic, explain how the extra money helped and how they will cope without it.

title: Afghanistan: Who's who in the Taliban leadership
description: What we know about the top figures in the militant group that has taken control of Afghanistan.

title: Taliban needs UN's humanitarian aid - UN boss
description: In return, the new regime must provide conditions for the UN to work in Afghanistan, secretary general tells BBC.

title: Business bosses warn new tax could hit jobs
description: Lobby groups have described a new health and social care tax as "ill-timed" and "illogical".

title: ‘We had to sell the house right away’
description: Sharon and Edith tell the BBC how they have been impacted by the crisis in social care.

title: Afghanistan: Dentist fears for family in hiding from Taliban
description: Suleyman Sakha says his in-laws, who worked for a humanitarian organisation, are living in dread.

title: Boris Johnson outlines health and social care tax to pay for reforms
description: Boris Johnson says it is a "responsible decision" but Labour calls the plan a "sticking plaster".

title: Michael K Williams: The Wire star remembered as 'a fine man and a rare talent'
description: Tributes are paid to Michael K Williams, best known for the HBO series, who has died at the age of 54.

title: London Underground: Man died after falling into gap, RAIB finds
description: He fell between the train and the platform while alighting and was not seen by the driver.

title: Police Scotland admits failures over M9 crash death
description: The force admits that failures in its call handling system "materially contributed" to a young woman's death.

title: Sexually transmitted infections fall during pandemic
description: Genital warts and herpes saw the biggest decrease, the figures for England reveal.

title: Afghanistan: Taliban fire warning shots at protest in Kabul
description: Unrest grows as more Afghans demand women's rights and chant anti-Taliban and anti-Pakistan slogans.

title: Covid: No plans for October lockdown, says government
description: Officials deny a newspaper report saying new rules could come in around England's half-term holiday.

title: England to make late call on Stokes for T20 World Cup
description: England will make a late decision over all-rounder Ben Stokes' place in the T20 World Cup squad, set to be named on Thursday.

title: Mexico: Flash flooding sweeps away cars after heavy rain
description: Heavy rain in central Mexico sparked flash floods in Ecatepec and Nexahualcóyotl.

title: Afghanistan: The pledge binding al-Qaeda to the Taliban
description: The history of the complex relationship between the two groups.

title: George Russell: Why Mercedes had to sign him - and what it might mean for team harmony
description: Lewis Hamilton repeatedly said he would prefer Valtteri Bottas to stay, writes Andrew Benson, but Mercedes could not pass up the chance to sign George Russell.

title: George Russell: Mercedes sign British F1 driver to partner Lewis Hamilton from 2022
description: Mercedes announce British driver George Russell will partner Lewis Hamilton from next season.

title: Climate change: Dragonflies spread north in warming world
description: The expansion of dragonflies across Britain and Ireland is an indicator of climate change, say experts.

title: BBC's director of news Fran Unsworth to leave the corporation
description: Fran Unsworth, who oversees all news and current affairs output, will leave at the start of 2022.

title: Fear and excitement in El Salvador as Bitcoin becomes legal tender
description: Millions of Salvadorians are expected to download a digital wallet app with $30 of free Bitcoin.

title: Justin Trudeau hit by stones on campaign trail
description: The Canadian leader's campaign has been disrupted by protesters angry at a planned vaccine mandate.

title: Australian bush rescue: Mother's reunion with boy lost for four days
description: Three-year-old Anthony "AJ" Elfalak is recovering with family after going missing for four days.

title: Climate change: Shetland's power struggle between oil and wind
description: The row over plans for a new oil field at Cambo has placed Shetland in the heart of the debate over energy production.

title: Nicola Sturgeon to set out plans for Holyrood year ahead
description: Scotland's first minister will announce her "programme for government" for the coming year at Holyrood.

title: The papers: NHS tax-rise anger and October firebreak plan
description: A "manifesto-busting" tax rise to help pay for the NHS is among a mix of stories leading the papers.

title: US Open: Why it is right to be excited about 'wise' & 'fearless' Emma Raducanu
description: As British teenager Emma Raducanu reaches the US Open quarter-finals, BBC Sport looks at why it is right to be excited by her journey.

title: Why social workers are being embedded in schools
description: A new project is embedding social workers in schools. How is it improving family life?

title: Baby Queen: Meet pop's boldest, sharpest new voice
description: "I have a problem releasing music that doesn't feel significant," says Bella Latham, aka Baby Queen.

title: Nizar Banat: The death shaking the Palestinian leadership
description: The killing of Nizar Banat in Palestinian custody has fuelled rare protests calling for change.
